course.title: Realism, Fantasy, and the Grotesque: Hoffmann and Balzac
course.description: A close reading of select works by E.T.A. Hoffmann and his reception in the work of Balzac focuses on Realism's indebtedness to the imaginative realms of the fantastic and the grotesque. Topics: music and inspiration; societal decadence and caricature; magic and the uncanny; experience, observation and expression.
course.notes: Texts may be read in English translation.
